titles.title: Zelda no Densetsu: Kamigami no Triforce (2005)
The Legend of Zelda: Triforce of the Gods
The Legend of Zelda: Legendary Edition
ゼルダの伝説 神々のトライフォース
The Legend of Zelda: A Link to the Past

title: Zelda no Densetsu: Kamigami no Triforce (2005)
title_english: The Legend of Zelda: A Link to the Past
title_japanese: ゼルダの伝説 神々のトライフォース
title_synonyms: The Legend of Zelda: Triforce of the Gods
The Legend of Zelda: Legendary Edition
synopsis: At the beginning of A Link to the Past, a young boy named Link is awakened by a telepathic message from Princess Zelda, who says that she is locked in the dungeon of Hyrule Castle. As the message closes, Link finds his uncle ready for battle, telling Link to remain in bed. However, Link ignores his uncle's command, and after his uncle leaves, follows him to Hyrule Castle. When he arrives, he finds his uncle seriously wounded. Link's uncle tells Link to rescue Princess Zelda from her prison, giving him a sword and shield. Link navigates the castle and rescues Zelda from her cell, and the two escape into a secret passage through the sewers that leads to a sanctuary.
background: Zelda no Densetsu: Kamigami no Triforce (2005) was published in English as The Legend of Zelda: A Link to the Past by VIZ Media under the VIZ Kids imprint on February 2, 2010. It was also included in the 10-volume box set released on October 25, 2011. The series was rereleased, alongside Zelda no Densetsu: Majora no Kamen, as the third volume of VIZ Media's The Legend of Zelda: Legendary Edition.
